posts.post_content:
I am very interested in acquiring a Cobb Uzit for my collection. 

I have cash, metals, and the below T206 trade list to work with. Please let me know if you may be a match by emailing me at t206society@gmail.com.

Thank you.

Respectfully,

Derek



1.)  Uzit ... Hughie Jennings (HOF) "both hands show" (PSA 2)

2.)  Uzit ... Barney Pelty "vertical" (SGC 3.5)

3.)  American Beauty 460 ... Ty Cobb (HOF) "bat off shoulder" (SGC 3)

4.)  Piedmont factory 42 ... Ty Cobb (HOF) "portrait; red" (PSA 1 ... I was murdered on this one for a small amount of paper loss but this is actually a gorgeous example that really pops in your hand)

5.)  Sweet Cap ... Clark Griffith (HOF) "portrait" (SGC 1.5) ... This is a unique and truly one of a kind T206 as it was owned by former Commissioner Bowie Kuhn from his childhood until his passing and is accompanied by a gracious letter by Mrs. Kuhn. As a young man Bowie kept the scoreboard for Washington which Clark Griffith was owner of and this card was given to him as a gift which he cherished.

6.)  Sovereign 150 ... Christy Mathewson (HOF) "portrait" (SGC 2) 

7.)  Polar Bear (missing IE in SERIES variation) ... Bill Bradley "with bat" (PSA 7 [MC])

8.)  American Beauty 350 framed ... Hal Chase "portrait; blue" (SGC 1.5)

9.)  Tolstoi ... Hal Chase "portrait; blue" (SGC 2)

10.)  American Beauty 350 framed ... Eddie Collins (HOF) (PSA 5)

11.)  Brown Hindu ... Ed Walsh (HOF) (SGC 3)

12.)  Old Mill ... Addie Joss (HOF) "portrait" (PSA 3)

13.)  Cycle 460 ... Frank Chance (HOF) "portrait; yellow" (PSA 2.5)

14.)  El Principe De Gales ... Nap Lajoie (HOF) "with bat" (PSA 3)

15.)  American Beauty 350 no frame ... Frank Baker (HOF) (PSA 2.5)

16.)  Tolstoi ... Zach Wheat (HOF) (PSA 4.5)
Nice cards you have! I'm assuming you've already seen it but there's a real nice one on eBay. I think it's a 6.5 GAI. I believe it's still there. Pricey but an awesome card.

[quote name="ronniehatesjazz" post=1631879]Nice cards you have! I'm assuming you've already seen it but there's a real nice one on eBay. I think it's a 6.5 GAI. I believe it's still there. Pricey but an awesome card.[/QUOTE]

Haha. Thank you Tyler! Unfortunately, the GAI 6.5 on Ebay is much too fancy for a man such as myself in terms of pricing. I do appreciate the heads up though.

Thank you.
